doc:
Lewis Martin (actor) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lewis_Martin_(actor) 0 Lewis Martin (1 November 1895, San Francisco – 21 February 1969, Los Angeles) was an American actor. Lewis Martin made his first Broadway appearance during 1925 in the play Lucky Sam McCarver. His career on Broadway was long and successful, he appeared in over 16 plays between 1925 and 1950. His film and television career started in 1950 with a supporting role in the Kraft Television Theatre. His first film was The Blazing Sun. He played supporting roles in films like The War of the Worlds (as Pastor Collins), The Court Jester (as Sir Finsdale) and Diary of a Madman (as Father Raymonde). Martin often played respectable figures like police officers, military men, judges or priests. Martin also appeared in numerous television series of the 1950s and 1960s, including Judge Libbott in four episodes of Perry Mason and Professor Henderson in three episodes of The George Burns and Gracie Allen Show. His last role was Commissioner West in two episodes of Tarzan in 1967. Lewis_Martin ( 1_November_1895 , San_Francisco – 21_February_1969 , Los_Angeles ) was an_American_actor . Lewis_Martin made his_first_Broadway_appearance during 1925 in the_play_Lucky_Sam_McCarver . His_career on Broadway was long_and_successful , he appeared in over_16_plays between 1925_and_1950 . His_film_and_television_career started in 1950 with a_supporting_role in the_Kraft_Television_Theatre . His_first_film was The_Blazing_Sun . He played_supporting roles in films like The_War of the_Worlds_( as Pastor_Collins_) , The_Court_Jester_( as Sir_Finsdale_)_and_Diary of a_Madman_( as Father_Raymonde_) . Martin often played respectable_figures like police_officers , military_men_,_judges_or_priests . Martin also appeared in numerous_television_series of the_1950s_and_1960s , including Judge_Libbott in four_episodes of Perry_Mason and Professor_Henderson in three_episodes of The_George_Burns and Gracie_Allen_Show . His_last_role was Commissioner_West in two_episodes of Tarzan in 1967 .
